title: CVE-2017-5482 The Q.933 parser in tcpdump before 4.9.0 has a buffer overflow in print-fr.c:q933_print().
content:
Reported to the project maintainers in 2016. Regardless of CVE-2016-8575 q933_print()
still could overread the buffer trying to parse a short packet. Fixed by https://github.com/the-tcpdump-group/tcpdump/commit/c39c1d99ac3b6d5d9519b39da6717180651650d3.
steps: Capture a short packet that triggers the Q.933 parser in tcpdump.
Run tcpdump with the captured packet to observe the buffer overflow in q933_print().
vuln_description: The Q.933 parser in tcpdump before 4.9.0 has a buffer overflow in print-fr.c:q933_print(). This vulnerability allows an attacker to overread the buffer when parsing a short packet, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution or a denial of service.
reason: The vulnerability involves a straightforward buffer overflow in a specific parser function. The discovery requires knowledge of the Q.933 protocol and the ability to craft or capture a short packet, but does not involve complex interactions or multiple components.
